intro: Syngonanthus xeranthemoides var. angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved synogonanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a compact growth habit with a rosette of leaves forming a dense cluster. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in arid ecosystems.
